page.title: 02Farming-Bolton by Bowland
page.content: This is a farming area.Most are{dairy farms keeping cows and calves although some fatten beef instead. Many farms keep{sheep}also which they sell at Gisburn, Clitheroe and Skipton markets. Lambing begins in January and goes on till the end of June on the hill farms. The lambs are kept for 2 or 3 months to fatten before going to auction. Most farms milk twice a day and sell all this milk to the milk marketing board. The tankers usually collect daily or every other day at isolated farms. In summer they make hay and silage for winter feed. In winter the cows are fed indoors on beet pulp, salt licks and phosphorus licks.
